effects: [CURSE] When you put the ring on, tendrils sprout from it and burrow into your finger from the ring's inner side. You cannot remove the ring willingly.
You gain 50% resistance to nec, psn, and psy dmg.
[CURSE] Whenever you complete a LR, you must either feed half your hit dice to the ring (rounded up) or gain 1 level of fatigue.

very rare.name: Blue Dragon Ring
effects: You have adv on saves against the Frightful Presence and breath weapons of dragons.
You have 50% resistance to light dmg.
1/LR, as an action, you can magically discern the distance and direction of the nearest blue dragon within 30 miles of you.

very rare.name: Insight Stone
effects: +2 WIS.

very rare.name: Poison Absorbing Ring
effects: You have 50% resistance to psn dmg.
1/LR, on taking psn dmg, you can react to gain imm against that instance of dmg and heal equal to half psn dmg dealt.

very rare.name: Ring of the Planes
effects: As an action, you can name a location that you are familiar with on another plane of existence, then make a DC 15 Intelligence check. On a success, you cast Plane Shift. On a fail, you and each creature and object within 15' of you travel to a random destination (roll d100, 1-60 is random location on plane you named, 61+ is on any random plane).

very rare.name: Intellect Stone
effects: +2 INT.

legendary.name: Ring of Djinni Summoning
effects: You can say 'Jinn' as an action to summon a particular Djinni from the Elemental Plane of Air. It appears in an unoccuddd space you choose within 120' of you, and remains as long as you concentrate, to a maximum of 1hr, or until it drops to 0 HP. It then returns to its home plane. If it returned above 0 HP, it cannot be summoned again for 24hrs. Otherwise, the ring becomes mundane.

While summoned, the Djinni is friendly to you and your companions. It obeys any commands you give it, no matter what language you use. If you fail to command it, the Djinni defends itself against attackers but takes no other actions.

legendary.name: Ring of Invulnerability
effects: You have resistance to non-magical dmg.
Once per long rest, you can use an action to make yourself immune to non-magical dmg for 10mins.

legendary.name: Stormclasp
effects: You have 50% resistance to light and thunder dmg.
Your Strength is always equal to 21 [L11+: 23], unless it would usually be higher.

1/LR, as an action, you may become a Storm Avatar for 1min, gaining the following benefits: immunity to light and thunder dmg; when you hit with a wep atk that normally deals B dmg, it deals thunder instead. P and S are similarly converted to light; As a bonus action, you can choose 1 creature you can see within 30' to be struck by lightning, forcing them to pass a DC 15 DEX save or take 3d6 [L11+: 4d6] light, or half as much on a success.
L11+: While transformed into a Storm Avatar, you gain 30' of fly speed and can hover.

legendary.name: Ascendant Dragon-Touched Focus
effects: You have adv on init rolls.
Your weapons gain the Conduit trait.

If your name starts with A-->I, whenever you use a spell slot to cast a spell that deals acid, cold, fire, light, or psn dmg, roll a d6, and you gain a bonus equal to the number rolled to one of the spell's dmg rolls.
If your name starts with A-->I, you can cast Hold Monster and Rime's Binding Ice, each once per long rest.
If your name starts with J-->R, whenever you use a spell slot to cast a spell, you can immediately teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 15' of you.
If your name starts with J-->R, you can cast Rary's Telepathic Bond and Raulothim's Psychic Lance, each once per long rest.
If your name starts with S-->Z, whenever a creature you can see within 30' of you makes a save, you can use your reaction to give that creature adv on the save.
If your name starts with S-->Z, you can cast Fizban's Platinum Shield and Legend Lore, each once per long rest.
1/LR, when casting a lvl'd spell, you can treat the spell as if it were cast using a 9th-lvl spell slot.

legendary.name: Ring of Mind Reading
effects: While touching the ring, you can cast the Scrying spell (DC 17) with it.

You can use an action to cast the Detect Thoughts spell (DC 17) while Scrying is active through the ring, targeting creatures you can see within 30 feet of the spell's sensor. You do not need to concentrate on this Detect Thoughts to maintain it during its duration, but it ends if Scrying ends.

legendary.name: Focus of Answering
effects: You can use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack against any creature in your reach that deals damage to you. You have advantage on the attack roll, and any damage dealt by the attack ignores immunities and resistances.

legendary.name: Holy Avenger
effects: Your wep hits deal +2d10 rad dmg vs fiends and undead.
You project a 10' aura that grants allies adv on mag saves.

legendary.name: Spell Ring
effects: This ring can store 1 spell of up to 5th lvl at a time.
When first found, roll a d6 and subtract 1. That is the level of spell in the ring (randomly chosen).
While the ring contains no spell, any creature can cast a levelled spell up to 5th lvl into it by touching it while casting. The spell has no effect other than being stored.
While touching the ring, you can cast the spell stored in it, using the stats of the original caster. This consumes the contained spell and the ring becomes empty.

If the ring is empty when you see a creature casting a spell within 60' of you, you can touch the ring as a reaction to attempt to interrupt the spell. If the spell is of 3rd lvl or lower, it has no effect and is instead stored in the ring. A higher-levelled spell requires you to make an INT check of DC 10 + the spell's lvl. On a success, it has no effect other than being stored in the ring.

legendary.name: Avenger of the Feral Guardian
effects: While shapeshifted, you have a +1 bonus to melee atk and dmg rolls [L11+: +2].
While shapeshifted, +1 AC [L11+: +2].
As an action 1/LR, you can cast Polymorph on yourself to shapeshift into a Giant Owl [L11+: Cave Bear]. You retain your mental ability scores when using the spell in this way.

If the ring is empty when you see a creature casting a spell within 60' of you, you can touch the ring as a reaction to attempt to interrupt the spell. If the spell is of 3rd lvl or lower, it has no effect and is instead stored in the ring. A higher-levelled spell requires you to make an INT check of DC 10 + the spell's lvl. On a success, it has no effect other than being stored in the ring.

legendary.name: Avenger of the Stilled Tongue
effects: As a bonus action 1/LR, you can cast any spell from your spell list without expending a spell slot or using any verbal or somatic component.
[CURSE] Vecna watches anyone wearing this ring. He can write cryptic msgs on the inside of its band, which appear at midnight and fade after being read.

legendary.name: Anulus Infinitus
effects: The following spells are added to your spell list: https://5e.tools/items.html#grimoire%20infinitus%20(awakened)_egw
You can have 1 [L11+: 2] additional spell prepared.
L11+: You have adv on magical saves.

legendary.name: Regeneration Stone
effects: At the end of each short rest, you heal 15 HP if you are conscious.
At the end of each journey activity a member of your party undertakes, you heal 15 HP.

legendary.name: P'all's Beholder Stone
effects: You gain 120' of darkvision, which also penetrates magical darkness.
The stone has 10 charges, 1d6 + 3 of which are recovered after a long rest.

As an action, you can expend charges to cast one of the following spells (DC 16): Charm Person (1 charge), Disintegrate (6 charges), Fear (3 charges), Finger of Death (7 charges), Flesh to Stone (6 charges), Hold Person (2 charges), Ray of Enfeeblement (2 charges), Sleep (1 charge), Slow (3 charges), or Telekinesis (5 charges).
[CURSE] When you attune to the stone, tendrils erupt from it and burrow into your flesh. You cannot remove it willingly.
[CURSE] While you are in the Colossal Tower, P'all can see through your eyes.

legendary.name: Blackloop
effects: Blackloop is a sentient chaotic evil ring with 17 INT, 10 WIS, and 19 CHA. It has hearing and darkvision of 120'. It communicates telepathically with its wearer, its voice deep and echoing, and can also speak/read/understand Common and any other languages you know.

Blackloop speaks with an imperious tone, as thought accustomed to being obeyed. Its purpose is to consume souls. It doesn't care whose souls it eats, including yours. The ring believes that all matter and energy sprang from a void of negative energy and will one day return to it. Blackloop is meant to hurry that process along.
On wep KB, the ring devours the target's soul, unless it is a construct or undead. A creature whose soul has been devoured by the ring can only be restored to life by the Wish spell.
Whenever the ring devours a soul, you gain temp HP equal to the creature's max HP. While you have this temp HP, you also have adv on any d20 rolls.
You are aware of the presence of any creatures within 60' of you that are not constructs or undead.
You cannot be charmed or frightened.
The ring can cast Haste 1/LR. It decides when to cast the spell and has its own concentration for it.
[CURSE] On wep hit vs undead, you take 1d10 nec dmg and the undead heals 1d10 HP. If this nec dmg reduces you to 0 HP, the ring devours your soul.
[CURSE] If the ring goes 3+ days without consuming any souls, a conflict between it and you occurs during your next long rest.

legendary.name: Talarith
effects: +1d6 force dmg to your wep hits.

1/SR, as an action, you can summon a golem minion that looks identical to you. The golem has the same statistics as you, including all of your equipment, except for this ring. The golem vanishes if it reaches 0 HP, or after 1hr.

legendary.name: Loop of Telepathy
effects: You can cast Scrying (save DC 17) at-will.

While scrying with the loop, you can communicate telepathically with creatures you can see within 30' of the spell's sensor. As an action 1/LR, you can also cast Suggestion (DC 17) through the sensor on one of those creatures. You don't need to concentrate on Suggestion when it is cast in this way, though it ends if the Scrying ends.

legendary.name: Defender
effects: The first time you make a wep atk on each of your turns, you can reduce your wep AB by up to 3 in order to gain that much AC, both until the start of your next turn. You must choose to do this before you make your atk roll.

legendary.name: Loop of the Prism
effects: +60' of darkvision.

On atk hit vs a beast, dragon, or monstrosity of up to CR 5 (L11+: CR 10), or when you grapple one, you can cast Dominate Monster (DC 13 (L11+: DC 15)) on the target. On a successful save, the creature is immune to this effect until it completes a LR. Otherwise, a larger, shimmering image of the ring appears as a collar around the target's neck until it is no longer affected by the spell. You can only have 1 creatured affected by the spell at once, but it doesn't require your concentration.

legendary.name: Ring of Air Elemental Command
effects: You have adv on atks vs elementals from the Elemental Plane of Air, and they have disadv on atks vs you.
The ring has 5 charges, 1d4 + 1 of which are recovered after a LR.
You can expend 2 charges to cast Dominate Monster (DC 17) on an Air Elemental.
You are imm to fall dmg.
You gain proficiency in Auran.

If your party kills an Air Elemental, you gain 50% resistance to light dmg, a fly sp (hover) equal to your sp, and can cast the following spells by expending charges (DC 17): Chain Lightning (3 charges), Gust of Wind (2 charges), Wind Wall (1 charge).

legendary.name: Nightfall Ring
effects: 1/LR, by spending 10 minutes activating the ring, you can cause night to fall within 10 miles of you. The artificial nightfall lasts for 24hrs, until you cancel it as an action, or until you take the ring off.

legendary.name: Ring of Lordly Might
effects: The ring has 6 buttons on it, each numbered 1-6. You can press one as a bonus action, and its effects last until you push a different button or until you cancel it by pressing the same button again.
1. Flames erupt from your melee weapons, shedding bright light for 40' and dim light for a further 40'. Add 2d6 fire dmg to your melee weapon hits.
2. Two crescent-shaped blades spring out from your melee weapons, changing their dmg dice to 1d10 S and replacing all of their traits with just the Sweep trait.
3. A spear point springs from your melee weapons, changing their dmg dice to 1d8 P and replacing all of their traits with just Thrown (40'/120').
4. The ring transforms into a ladder up to 50' tall that can bear up to 4 tonnes.
5. The ring transforms into a handheld battering ram that grants you +10 to STR checks to break through barriers.
6. The ring gives you a constant indication of where north is, as well as your approximate vertical distance from surface ground.
1/LR, on melee wep hit, you can force the target to make a DC 17 CON save. On a fail, they take 4d6 additional nec dmg and you regain HP equal to half that dmg.
1/LR, on melee wep hit, you can force the target to make a DC 17 STR save. On a fail, they are staggered until save.
1/LR, on melee wep hit, you can force the target to make a DC 17 WIS save. On a fail, they are fright of you until save.

legendary.name: Ring of Invisibility
effects: As an action, you can become invisible, or end this invisibility.

The ring has a maximum duration of 2hrs, which is deducted from while you are using the invisibility. Whenever you spend a full day not using the invisibility, the ring regains up to 2hrs of duration.

legendary.name: Ruby Weave Ring
effects: At the end of each LR, choose a spell from any spell list. You count as having this spell prepared until your next LR.

legendary.name: Moonring
effects: [CURSE] If the ring considers you craven, erratic, corrupt, or at odds with preserving and protecting elvenkind, it rejects you - you make d20 rolls with disadv for 24hrs, after which the ring is destroyed.

The ring is a sentient neutral good item with 12 INT, 10 WIS, and 12 CHA. It has hearing + darkvision out to 120 feet. It communicates by transmitting emotions, sending a tingling sensation through its wearer's hand when it wants to communicate something it has sensed. It can communicate more explicitly through dreams while the wearer is asleep.
The ring seeks the advancement of elvenkind and elven ideals: courage, loyalty, beauty, music, and life. The ring is overconfident.
The ring has a rune on it for each creature that has attuned to it (1d6 + 1 initially). Each rune provides a random weapon modifier.

legendary.name: Infiltrator's Ring
effects: You have adv on Sleight of Hand checks made to pick locks (this does not affect Rob journey activity checks).
You have adv on Stealth checks made to move silently (this affects Scout journey activity checks).
L11+: As a bonus action, you can transform the ring into a magical +1 dagger, or back into ring form.
L11+: As an action, you can cast each of the following spells 1/LR each: Alter Self, Invisibility, Knock, or Pass Without Trace.

artifact.name: Ring of the Black Crown
effects: The ring is a sentient lawful evil object with INT 20, WIS 12, and CHA 18. It has hearing and darkvision of 120'. It communicates telepathically with its wearer and is prof in common + infernal.

A greedy Erinyes named Xartaza lives within the ring. She wants to recruit more souls for Asmodeus, so the ring pushes its wearer toward lawful evil actions by manipulating their dreams. A former war general, Xartaza hates demons and Mensis, and relishes crafting sound battle plans in any conflict.
You gain prof in Infernal.

As a bonus action, you can say 'Xartaza' to cause the ring to erupt into flame, shedding bright/dim light for 40'/40'. While ablaze, your wep hits deal 1d6 (L11+: 2d6) additional fire dmg. Flames last until you use another bonus action or are no longer wearing the ring.
1/LR, as action, can summon Imp (L11+: Bearded Devil) minion that lasts 10mins.
L11+: You have 50% resistance to psn dmg.

artifact.name: Dekella, Ring of Thassa
effects: +2d10 cold dmg to your wep hits.
If you devote yourself spiritually to The Cloud, you can breathe underwater and gain a swimming speed of 60'.
If you do not devote yourself spiritually to The Cloud, you have -1 global AB and -1 to your DCs.

1/LR, as an action, you can change the condition of the sea within 1 mile of you, creating strong winds and heavy rain that cause violent waves or calming a storm. In either case, the unnatural weather lasts 1hr before returning to normal.
1/LR, you can cast Dominate Monster (DC 18), but only on beasts and monstrosities with an innate swim speed.
1/LR, you can case True Polymorph (DC 18), but you must cast it on a creature to turn it into a kind of creature that has an innate swim speed.

artifact.name: Ring of Iggwilv
effects: The ring has 8 charges, of which it recovers 1d8 at the end of each long rest.
As an action, you may cast Hideous Laughter (DC 20).

You may expend charges from the ring to cast any of the following spells (all DC 20): Magic Circle (1 charge), Magic Jar (3 charges), Planar Ally (3 charges), Planar Binding (2 charges), Plane Shift (to the Infinite Rooms of the Black Cathedral only; 3 charges), or Summon Fiend (Demon only; 3 charges)
Whenever you make an Intelligence check to discern information about demons or a Survival check related to the Black Cathedral, you can add double your prof bonus to the check.
When you make a dmg roll for a spell you cast against a fiend, you use the maximum possible result instead of rolling.
Whenever you cast Magic Circle and only name fiends, or Planar Binding targeting a fiend, the spell is upcast to 9th lvl. Additionally, the fiend has disadvantage on its save against the spell.

As an action once per long rest, you can target a fiend you can see that is trapped within a Magic Circle. It must pass a DC 20 CHA save with disadvantage or become trapped within the ring. You know a creature's widely-known name and its depravities while it is trapped.

[CURSE] Whenever you finish a long rest, the creature trapped in the ring of the highest CR can attempt to possess you. You must pass a DC 20 CHA save, or are possessed by the creature, which controls you completely. The possessing creature can release you as an action, appearing in the closest unoccupied space. On a successful save, that creature cannot attempt to possess you for 7 days.
When you first find the ring, it already contains 1d4 random demons.

artifact.name: Ring of Vecna
effects: [CURSE] When you attune to the ring, your left eye rots away and falls out. You can see out of the ring.
[CURSE] If you unattune from the ring, you die.
[CURSE] Your Alignment changes to Neutral Evil.
You have truesight.

As an action, you can see into and through solid matter until you end the effects as a bonus action. This vision has a radius of 30', and can penetrate 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, and 3 feet of wood/dirt. Lead cannot be seen through.
The ring has 8 charges. 1d4 + 4 charges are recovered at the end of a long rest.

You can expend charges as an action to cast any of the following spells (DC 18): Clairvoyance (2 charges), Crown of Madness (1 charge), Disintegrate (4 charges), Dominate Monster (5 charges), or Eyebite (4 charges).

[CURSE] Whenever you cast a spell from this ring, there is a 5% chance that Vecna tears your soul from your body, devours it, and takes control of your body. You are killed and your body becomes an NPC under the DM's control.

artifact.name: The Bloody End
effects: The ring is a sentient lawful evil item with 22 INT, 18 WIS, and 24 CHA. It has hearing and darkvision to a range of 120'. It communicates telepathically with its wearer and is prof in Common and Infernal for speaking aloud.

A tyrannical Pit Fiend named Izeelzee lives within the ring. It pushes its wielder to subjugate others and to never back down from a challenge. If the wearer doesn't demand fealty from others, the ring will do so on their behalf.
You become proficient in Infernal.
As an action, you can cast one of the following spells (DC 13 (L11+: DC 15)): Charm Person, Dominate Person, Fear. Each spell can only be cast 1/LR.
You have adv on Intimidation checks.
L11+: On wep KB, you can force each creature of your choice within 15' of you to make a DC 15 WIS save or be frightened of you until the end of your next turn. This can be done 1/LR.
L11+: When hit by a melee atk, you can react to deal 1d6 psy thorns dmg to the atker.

artifact.name: Will of the Talon
effects: The ring is a sentient lawful evil item with 14 INT, 15 WIS, and 19 CHA. It has hearing and darkvision out to 120'. It communicates telepathically with its wearer and is proficient in Common, Draconic, and Infernal for speaking aloud.

A short-tempered Bone Devil named Ashtyrion lives within the ring. It is greedy and values strong leadership. It demands that its wielder take decisive action to keep order in high-pressure situations - and to always take a fair of treasure in return.
You gain prof in Draconic and Infernal.

As a bonus action 1/LR, you can force each creature of your choice within 30' of you that is aware of you to make a DC 13 (L11+: DC 15) WIS save. On a fail, a creature becomes frightened of you until save. On succeeding against or ending the effect, it is immune to this power for 24hrs.

As an action, you can exhale destructive energy. Choose the properties of a Dragonborn breath weapon and exhale it. All affected creatures make a DC 13 (L11+: DC 15) save, taking 3d6 (L11+: 4d6) dmg on a fail or half as much on a success. You can only do this with each dmg type 1/LR.
L11+: You have 50% resistance to acid, cold, fire, light, and psn dmg.

artifact.name: Khrusor, Ring of Gawdian
effects: +2d8 rad dmg to your wep hits.
If you devote yourself spiritually to Gawdian, you gain 15 temp HP at the end of each LR.
If you do not devote yourself spiritually to Gawdian, you have -1 global AB and -1 to your DCs.
The ring sheds sunlight in a 30' radius and dim light for an additional 30'.
1/LR, when you take dmg from an adj creature, you can react to make a melee wep atk against that creature. On a hit, the target is blinded until the start of its next turn.
The ring has 10 charges, 1d6 + 4 of which are replenished at the end of a long rest.
You can expend the ring's charges to cast the following spells (DC 18): Guiding Bolt (1 charge), Daylight (3 charges, targeting the ring only), Sunbeam (6 charges).

artifact.name: Sign of the Dwarvish Lords
effects: +2 CON.
You have adv on Persuasion vs Dwarves.
50% chance at the end of each LR to grow a full beard, or a much thicker one if you already have one.
If you are not a Dwarf, you gain adv on saves vs psn'd and 50% resistance vs psn dmg.
You gain 60' of darkvision.
If you are not a Dwarf, you gain prof in Dwarvish.
Your weapons gain the Thrown (20'/60') trait.
+1d8 B dmg to your thrown wep hits, which increases to +2d8 vs giants.
+14 wep crit dmg.
On wep crit, 5% chance to chop off one of your target's limbs, if possible.
As a free action, you can say 'Dweorg' to have the ring shed 10' of bright light and 10' of dim until you say the word again.
If you are a Dwarf, you gain immunity to psn dmg.
If you are a Dwarf, you gain an expertise die in Crafting Creation checks for metal weapons and armour.
Once per long rest as an action, you can cast Conjure Elemental, summoning an Earth Elemental always.

As an action once every 3 days, you can touch the ring to a fixed piece of Dwarven stonework to cast Teleport. If your intended destination is underground, there is no chance of any error in the spell.
[CURSE] Whenever you finish a long rest, you look more and more like a Dwarf, and completely look like one after 7 days. Effect can be reversed by removing a curse from the wearer.

artifact.name: Sign of Kas
effects: The sign is a sentient chaotic evil ring with 15 INT, 13 WIS, and 16 CHA. It has hearing and darkvision out to 120'. It communicates telepathically with its wearer and can speak proficiently in Common.
The sign's purpose is to bring ruin to liches, their worshipers, minions, works, and artifacts.
You have +1 crit range with melee wep atks.
Your melee wep hits deal +2d10 S dmg against undead creatures.

If the sign isn't bathed in blood within 1min of you rolling init, you must make a DC 15 CHA save. On a success, you take 3d6 psy dmg. On a fail, you are dominated by the sign's sentience, which demands that it be bathed in blood. The spell's effect ends when this demand is met.
Add 1d10 to your init.
Whenever you would make a melee wep atk, you may transfer some or all of the wep's AB to your AC, which lasts until the start of your next turn.
Once per long rest each, as an action, you can cast one of the following spells (DC 18): Call Lightning, Divine Word, or Finger of Death.

artifact.name: Mighty Sign of Leuk-o
effects: As a free action 1/turn, you can shapeshift into a Mighty Servant of Leuk-o (https://5e.tools/bestiary.html#mighty%20servant%20of%20leuk-o_tce).
Two creatures can be attuned to the sign at once, but only one of them can be shapeshifted with it at a time.

[CURSE] If a creature shapeshifted into the Mighty Servant loses half the form's HP, each creature attuned to the sign must make a DC 20 WIS save or be charmed for 24hrs. When charmed in this way, a creature goes on a destructive spree, seeking to destroy structures and atk any unattuned creatures within sight, starting with those threatening the Mighty Servant form.

There is a hidden self-destruction code for the sign (DM knows). If 2 creatures attuned to it spend their actions for 3 consecutive turns thinking about the code while touching the ring, it explodes. All creatures within 100' of the ring must make a DC 25 DEX save. On a fail, a creature takes 25d6 force, 25d6 light, and 25d6 thunder dmg, or half as much on a succ. This deals triple dmg to objs and structs. The attuned creatures are both killed instantly and their corpses evaporate.
[CURSE] If the above self-destruction process begins, the charm effect from above is triggered, but only turning the attuned creatures against each other.

artifact.name: Sign of Broken Mirrors
effects: The sign is a sentient chaotic evil ring with 21 INT, 24 WIS, and 24 CHA. It has hearing and darkvision out to 120'. It comms telepathically with its wearer, and can speak/read/understand Abyssal and Common.

An insane Glabrezu demon named Ragazuu lives within the sign. The ring years to cause chaos. It learns its wearer's principles, then uses those ideals to encourage reckless action. It whispers ideas of revolution.
You gain prof in Abyssal.
On wep KB vs humanoid, Ragazuu remembers the target's appearance until the sign is attuned to a new creature.
As an action, you can change your form to match any humanoid Ragazuu remembers. You can revert as an action, and you do so when you die.
L11+: As an action, you can cast one of the following spells (DC 15, 1/LR each): Fabricate, Hallucinatory Terrain, Majro Image, or Phantasmal Killer.

artifact.name: Ruin's Wake
effects: The ring is a sentient chaotic evil item with 20 INT, 16 WIS, and 22 CHA. It has hearing and darkvision of 120', can communicate telepathically with its wearer, and can speak/read/understand Abyssal, Common, and Orcish.
A slaughter-loving Balor demon named Yarrowish lives within the ring. It desires only to draw blood and pushes its wearer to solve problems with violence.
You gain proficiency in Abyssal and Orcish.
+1d8 P [L11+: +2d8] dmg to your wep hits.
1/SR, as a reaction when you are hit by a melee atk, you can make a melee wep atk with adv against the atker.

L11+: 1/LR, when you make a thrown wep atk, you can say 'ruina' to transform the proj into a bolt of lightning, forming a line that extends to a creature you can see within 120' of you. Each creature in the line must make a DC 15 DEX save, taking 8d6 light dmg on a failed save, or half as much dmg on a success.

artifact.name: Teeth of Ronald Gascon
effects: As an action, you can pull a tooth from the ring, rolling 1d20 on the following chart: https://5e.tools/items.html#teeth%20of%20dahlver-nar_tce . Each tooth can only be pulled once (round down when rolling a missing tooth).

You may sow any tooth you pull from the ring. To do so, place it on the ground in an empty space within your reach, or throw it into an empty space within 10' of you in a body of water that is at least 50'x50'. Upon doing so, the tooth burrows into the ground or vanishes into the water, leaving no hole behind. The creatures in the Creatures Summoned column appear in an empty space as close to where the tooth was sown as possible. These are allies to you, speak all languages you speak, and linger for 10mins before disappearing, unless otherwise noted.

Alternatively, you may implant any tooth you pull from the ring. To do so, place it in your mouth, causing one of your own teeth to fall out, and the new one takes its place, resizing to fit your mouth. Once implanted, you gain the effect from the Implanted Effect column. The tooth cannot be removed voluntarily. If removed after your death, the tooth vanishes. You can have a maximum number of the teeth implanted at once equal to 1 + your CON mod. If exceeded, the new tooth replaces one of the previous teeth randomly.
Once all the teeth have been pulled from the ring, it vanishes. The ring then reforms will all its teeth in a random location at a random point on the Material Plane.

artifact.name: Grovelthrash
effects: Grovelthrash is a sentient, neutral evil ring with 18 INT, 15 WIS, and 19 CHA. It has hearing and darkvision of 120'. It communicates telepathically with its wearer and can speak, read, and understand Abyssal, Common, and Infernal.

A covetous Ultraloth named Ciria lives within Grovelthrash. The ring values material possessions and doling out pain. It compliments its wearer whenever they claim treasure and takes pleasure in harming others.
You gain prof in Abyssal and Infernal.
You can have your melee wep hits deal +2d6 B dmg, but then you take 1d6 psy dmg.
Your melee wep hits deal double dmg to objs and structs.
You have adv on Insight checks made to discern a lie spoken in a language you understand.
L11+: You gain an burrowing speed equal to your speed. You can use this speed to move through ice.
L11+ 1/LR, when a creature you can see within 30' of you hits you with an atk, you can react to deal an amount of psy dmg to the atker equal to the dmg you took from the atk.

artifact.name: Silken Spite
effects: Silken Spite is a sentient, chaotic evil ring with 13 INT, 15 WIS, and 15 CHA. It has hearing and darkvision of 120'. It communicates telepathically with its wearer and can speak, read, and understand Abyssal, Common, Elvish, and Undercommon.
[CURSE] A murderous Yochlol named Sinnafex lives within Silken Spite. The ring speaks in whispers, pushing its wearer to trust no one and to kill those who cause the slightest personal offence.
You gain prof in Abyssal, Elvish, and Undercommon.
You gain +60' darkvision.

As an action, you can coat your weapon in poison until it scores a hit. That hit forces its target to make a DC 13 (L11+: DC 15) CON save or become psn'd for 1hr. On a sub fail, it is also uncon until it takes dmg or is woken as an action.
You can walk on vertical surfaces and upside down.
You gain climbing sp equal to your sp.
You cannot be caught in webs of any sort and can move through them as if they were diff terrain.
L11+: As an action, you can cast each of the following spells 1/LR each (DC 15): Cloudkill, Darkness, Levitate, or Web.

artifact.name: Band of the Wanderer
effects: [CURSE] Every month, your alignment shifts one grid space towards chaotic neutral, and you become more and more compelled to engage with and explore the most dangerous planes.
The band has 7 charges, 1d4 + 4 of which are recovered after a LR.

As an action, you can expend charges to cast one of the following spells (DC 17): Contact Other Plane (3 charges), Demiplane (6 charges), Gate (7 charges), Plane Shift (5 charges), or Teleportation Circle (3 charges).

artifact.name: Baba Yaga's Ring
effects: You can swap this ring between visible or invisible at will as a free action.
The ring has 12 charges, all of which are recovered after a LR.
On melee wep hit, you can expend up to 3 of the loop's charges to deal an additional 1d8 force dmg per charge expended.
